meanings.definition: Remove from the center of activity or attention.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the injured player was sidelined and had to watch from the bench.
meanings.sent2: The coach sidelined the player who was causing disruptions during practice.
meanings.sent3: The cat was sidelined from the room when the guests with allergies arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter sidelined the serious discussion in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rainstorm sidelined our plans for a picnic in the park.

meanings.definition: Prevent from participating in an activity or situation.
meanings.sent1: Due to his injury, he was sidelined from the marathon race.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules sidelined many students from joining the club.
meanings.sent3: The broken swing sidelined the children from playing in the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights sidelined her from enjoying the roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The power outage sidelined the employees from completing their work on time.

meanings.definition: Put out of action or commission.
meanings.sent1: The storm sidelined the ferry service, leaving passengers stranded.
meanings.sent2: A flat tire sidelined the car, delaying the road trip.
meanings.sent3: The spilled drink sidelined the laptop, causing it to malfunction.
meanings.sent4: The virus sidelined the computer system, halting all operations.
meanings.sent5: The engine failure sidelined the airplane, leading to flight cancellations.
